item.description:
Join Greater Worcester Humanists in September for our yearly "Humanism" centered meeting. We like to take the opportunity once a year to share what Humanism is and what it means to us as individuals and as a group.   

You are welcome to arrive and mingle around 6:30 PM. We will begin the formal meeting at 7 PM with an overview of the past years events and speakers. As always this and most of our events are open to the public. 

We will then have our small group discussions, each headed by two members of our Steering and Outreach Committees. The committee members will head off discussions at each table by relating.  This years topic is about how you live out your Humanistic values.  Do you openly express your Humanism and try to explain it to people, or do you let it guide you in your decision making process?  Everyone is a little different, why not share?  The committee members will start with their individual stories and then invite individuals to share their experiences.
item.name: Paths to Humanism 2011 - Living our Humanist Values
